text: James Roland Dwyer (1902–1983) was an Australian rugby league footballer who played in the 1920s. Dwyer was a pioneer player for the St. George club in their early years. A huge Front Row Forward from the Brighton juniors, Dwyer played one season for the Saints before embarking on a career in boxing in 1923 The MARCH OF THE DRAGONS by Ian Heads. 1998 (), and became national heavy-weight champion under the name Jim Rowland.Encyclopedia Of Rugby League Players by Whiticker/Hudson. 1993 Edition () Dwyer died in Ramsgate, New South Wales on 13 May 1983.Sydney Morning Herald: Death Notice 16/5/1983 ==References== Category:St. George Dragons players Category:Australian male boxers Category:Australian rugby league players Category:Rugby league props Category:1902 births Category:1983 deaths
title: Jim Dwyer (rugby league)
